flavorText: The Dead awaken; for the hour is come for the oathbreakers; at the Stone of Erech they shall stand again.
name: Dead Men of Dunharrow
text: +{attack}{attack} +{defense}{defense} supporting Strider or Aragorn.

flavorText: The company of knights in full harness was riding grey horses, and behind them seven hundreds of men at arms, tall as lords, grey-eyed, dark-haired, singing as they came.
name: Knights of Dol Amroth
text: +{defense} on Dol Amroth.

flavorText: The Guards were robed in black, but the helms gleamed with a flame of silver, for they were indeed wrought of mithril, heirlooms from the glory of old days.
name: Guards of the Citadel
text: +{defense} on Minas Tirith.

flavorText: And so the companies came and were hailed and cheered and passed through the Gate, men of the Outlands marching to defend the City of Gondor in a dark hour.
name: Soldiers of Gondor
The Great Gate
text: +{defense}{defense}{defense} on Minas Tirith. This card cannot be played or moved to a Shadow battleground.

name: Aragorn
text: When played, remove Strider from the game. While in reserve, draw 1 additional card each Draw Step. If forsaken from the top of your draw deck, cycle this card instead of eliminating it.

name: Boromir
text: When played, draw 1 card. Additionally, when played or moved to a path, you must forsake 1 card.

name: Denethor
text: If in reserve, you may use your action and forsake 1 card to take Boromir or Faramir from your draw deck into hand.

flavorText: He could see Faramir's face, which was now unmasked; it was stern and commanding, and a keen wit lay behind his searching glance.
name: Faramir
text: When played or moved to a path 7, you may activate a different path 7.

name: Halbarad
text: If in reserve, you may use your action and cycle this card to take Strider or Aragorn from your draw deck into hand.

name: Prince Imrahil
text: When played, you may cycle 1 card from hand to take Knights of Dol Amroth from your draw deck into hand.

name: Strider
text: If on a path, you may use your action to activate a path of the next higher number. If Aragorn is played, eliminate this card.

name: Andúril
text: Weapon. If in reserve, you may use your action to activate or reactivate any Dúnedain battleground; then, you must move the wielder to that battleground (even if it was played this round).

flavorText: The blade was wrought of some strange metal, light and strong, and set with many fiery stones. It seemed untouched by time, unrusted, sharp, glittering in the sun.
name: Blade of Westernesse
text: Weapon.

flavorText: The days are short. If thou art in haste, remember the Paths of the Dead.
name: Paths of the Dead
text: Forsake 2 cards and then draw 4 cards, or 5 if Strider or Aragorn is in reserve.

flavorText: 'The Red Arrow!' said Théoden, holding it, as one who receives a summons long expected and yet dreadful when it comes.
name: The Red Arrow
text: This round, Rohan cards may be played or moved to Dúnedain battlegrounds.

name: The Three Hunters
text: This round, Legolas, Gimli, and Strider (or Aragorn) can be played or moved to any battleground and may be supported by any Free Peoples army.

name: Ioreth
text: After a battleground combat including this card, you may cycle it and one other non-Wizard Free Peoples character in that combat instead of eliminating them. Any wielded items are eliminated.

flavorText: They will cast all away rather than submit to Sauron; for they know him now.
name: High Elves

flavorText: "I remember well the splendour of their banners."
name: High Elves
Arwen
text: When played, draw 1 card. While in reserve, add {defense} and {pathDefense} to Strider or Aragorn.

name: Elrond
text: When played, draw 1 card. While in reserve, increase your carryover limit by 1.

name: Galadriel
text: When played, draw 1 card. While in reserve, draw 1 additional card each Draw Step, then cycle 1 card from hand.

name: Legolas
text: When played, you may take Bow of the Galadhrim from your draw deck into hand.

name: Bow of the Galadhrim
text: Weapon. The wielder of this card cannot wield another weapon.

name: Elven Cloak
text: If the wielder is eliminated during path combat, cycle it instead, along with any wielded items.

name: Lembas
text: If on a path, the Hobbit player may use an action and eliminate this card to remove 1 corruption for each Hobbit character on the path.

flavorText: "What you will see, if you leave the Mirror free to work, I cannot tell."
name: Mirror of Galadriel
text: While in play, you may always examine the top card of your draw deck.

name: Nenya, Ring of Adamant
text: If in reserve, you may use your action and cycle this card to add {pathDefense} to the active path, or to add {defense} to an active battleground.

flavorText: "May it be a light to you in dark places, when all othe rlights go out."
name: Phial of Galadriel
text: If on a path, add {pathDefense}{pathDefense} to the path (not to the wielder).

name: Vilya, Ring of Air
text: If in reserve, you may use your action and cycle this card so each Free Peoples player draws 1 card.

flavorText: "I will tread the path with you, Gandalf!" said Gimli.
name: Gimli
text: When played, you may take Dwarven Axe from your cycle pile into hand.

flavorText: "My axe is restless in my hand. Give me a row of orc-necks and room to swing and all weariness will fall from me!"
name: Dwarven Axe
text: Weapon.

name: Bilbo Baggins
text: If eliminated for any reason (including being forsaken), cycle this card instead. If in reserve, you may use your action and cycle this card to draw 2 cards.

name: Fatty Bolger
text: If in reserve, you may use your action and eliminate this card to draw 3 cards. If in reserve when forsaken, cycle this card instead of eliminating it.

name: Frodo Baggins
text: If eliminated for any reason (including being forsaken), cycle this card instead. This does not apply to any wielded items.

name: Merry Brandybuck
text: May be played or moved to a Rohan battleground and supported by a Rohan army. If eliminated in path combat, cycle this card instead, along with any wielded items.

name: Pippin Took
text: May be played or moved to a Dúnedain battleground and supported by a Dúnedain army. If eliminated in path combat, cycle this card instead, along with any wielded items.

name: Sam Gamgee
text: If in reserve, you may use your action and cycle this card, along with any wielded items, to add {pathDefense} to the active path.

name: Herbs and Stewed Rabbit
text: If in play, you may use your action and eliminate this card to take a Hobbit character from your cycle pile into hand, and then draw 1 card.

flavorText: Sting flashed out, and the sharp elven-blade sparkled in the silver light ...
name: Sting
text: Weapon. +{pathDefense} if the wielder is on the same path as a Monstrous character.

name: There is Another Way
text: Activate a different path with the same number as the active path: add {pathDefense} to the new path.

flavorText: In their hands were tall spears of ash, painted shileds were slung at their backs, long swords were at their belts, thier burnished skirts of mail hung down upon their knees.
name: Riders of Rohan

flavorText: With astonishing speed, the riders checked their steeds, wheeled, and came charging round.
name: Riders of Rohan

flavorText: Most of these men have seen too many winters, or too few.
name: Village Militia
Éomer
text: When played, draw 5 cards: from these play up to 1 Rohan army, and cycle the rest.

name: Éowyn
text: When played to a battleground, you may choose a Nazgûl character on that battleground and eliminate it. When played to reserve, you may take Merry or Pippin from your cycle pile into hand.

name: Théoden
text: +{attack} +{defense} if Gandalf is in play. When played, draw 5 cards: from these play up to 1 Rohan card, and cycle the rest.

name: Shadowfax
text: Mount. If in reserve, you may use your action to activate or reactive any battleground; then, you must move the wielder to that battleground (even if it was played this round).

name: Death! Ride, Ride to Ruin!
text: Eliminate any number of Rohan cards from reserve; the Mordor player must eliminate the same number of Mordor cards from active battlegrounds.

name: Ghân-buri-Ghân
text: While in reserve, Rohan cards may be played or moved to Minas Tirith.

name: Gandalf the Grey
text: If on a path, you may use your action to activate a path of the next higher number. If Gandalf the White is played, eliminate this card.

name: Gandalf the White
text: When played, remove Gandalf the Grey from the game. While in reserve, draw 1 additional card each Draw Step. If forsaken from the top of your draw deck, cycle this card instead of eliminating it.

name: Gwaihir the Windlord
text: If in reserve, you may use your action and cycle this card to take Gandalf the Grey or Gandalf the White from your cycle pile into hand.

name: Quickbeam
text: Ent. +{attack} +{defense} for every 2 Isengard character and/or army cards on the same battleground (rounded down).

name: Sméagol
text: If on a path, you may use your action and add 1 corruption to activate a path of the next higher number. If this card is eliminated in path combat, cycle it instead.

name: Treebeard
text: Ent. +{attack} on Orthanc. When played or moved to a battleground, the Isengard player must eliminate 1 Isengard army on that battleground.

name: Ent-Draught
text: If in play, you may use your action and eliminate this card so the Hobbit player may take up to 2 Hobbit characters from its cycle pile into hand.

flavorText: He raised his staff, adn for a brief instant there was blaze like a flash of lightning.
name: Gandalf's Staff
text: Weapon. While in play, increase your carryover limit by 1.

flavorText: Gandalf stood in the middle of the span, leaning on the staff in his left hand, but in his other hand Glamdring gleamed, cold and white.
name: Glamdring
text: Weapon.

name: Narya, Ring of Fire
text: If in reserve, you may use your action and cycle this card so each Shadow player must cycle 1 card from hand.

flavorText: There was a crash and a flash of flame and smoke: a gaping hole was blasted in the wall.
name: Devilry of Saruman

flavorText: We are the Uruk-hai: we do not stop the fight for night or day, for fair weather or for storm. We come to kill, by sun or moon.
name: Fighting Uruk-hai

flavorText: He emptied Isengard. I saw the enemy go: endless lines of marching Orcs: and troops of them mounted on great wolves.
name: Wolf-Riders

flavorText: We are the servants of Saruman the Wise, the White Hand: the Hand that gives us man's-flesh to eat.
name: White Hand Orcs

flavorText: ... blazoned upon every helm and shield the ghastly hand of Isengard was seen.
name: White Hand Orcs
Gríma Wormtongue
text: If in reserve, you may use your action and eliminate this card to either take Saruman from your draw deck into hand, or eliminate a Rohan character of your choice in play.

name: Saruman
text: While in reserve, draw 1 additional card each Draw Step. If forsaken from the top of your draw deck, cycle this card instead of eliminating it.

name: Uglúk
text: If on a path, you may use your action to activate a different path of the same number.

name: Palantír of Orthanc
text: If in reserve, once per round you may use your action to examine the top 3 cards of your draw deck. From these, eliminate 1, cycle 1, then take the remaining card into hand.

flavorText: He struck him with his staff ...
name: Saruman's Staff
text: Weapon. While in play, increase your carryover limit by 1.

name: Woven of All Colours
text: If the wielder is eliminated in combat, cycle it instead, along with any wielded items.

name: Threats and Promises
text: If Saruman is in reserve, activate or reactive any Isengard battleground; then, you may move Saruman to that battleground (even if Saruman was played this round).

flavorText: They brandished spears and scimitars which shone red as blood in the firelight.
name: Goblins of the Misty Mountains

flavorText: The Misty Mountains were crawling like anthills: orcs were issuing out of a thousand holes.
name: Goblins of the Misty Mountains
Balrog of Moria
text: +{pathAttack} on Khazad-dûm. When played or moved to a path or battleground, each Free Peoples player must forsake 1 card.

name: Barrow-Wights
text: If in reserve, you may use your action and eliminate this card so each Free Peoples player must forsake 1 card.

name: Candles of Corpses
text: +{pathAttack} on Dead Marshes. If in reserve, you may use your action and eliminate this card so each Free Peoples player must forsake 1 card.

name: Caradhras the Cruel
text: When played to the Caradhras path, activate a different Path 4. If in reserve, you may use your action and eliminate this card so each Free Peoples player must forsake 1 card.

name: Cave-Troll
text: If in reserve, you may use your action and eliminate this card so each Free Peoples player must forsake 1 card.

name: Flocks of Crebain
text: If on a path, you may use your action to activate a different path of the same number.

name: Gollum
text: If on a path, you may use your action to activate a different path of the same number. If this card is eliminated in path combat, cycle it instead.

name: Hill-Troll
text: If in reserve, you may use your action and eliminate this card so each Free Peoples player must forsake 1 card.

name: Shelob
text: +{pathAttack} on Shelob's Lair. When played or moved to a path, each Free Peoples player must forsake 1 card.

flavorText: It raised the whip, and the thongs whined and cracked. Fire came from its nostrils.
name: Whip of Many Thongs
text: When played, draw 1 card.

name: Coastal Raiders
text: +{attack} on Dol Amroth. If in reserves, you may use your action and eliminate this card to activate Dol Amroth if it is in the Free Peoples battleground deck.

name: Corsairs of Umbar
text: If in reserve, you may use your action and eliminate this card to activate Umbar if it is in the Shadow battleground deck.

flavorText: There came great beasts, like moving houses in the red and fitful light, the mûmakil of the Harad.
name: Haradrim Mûmakil
Haradrim Regulars
text: If in reserve, you may use your action and eliminate this card to activate Harad if it is in the Shadow battleground deck.

name: Haradrim Cavalry
text: +{attack} on Minas Tirith. If in reserve, you may use your action and eliminate this card to activate Minas Tirith if it is in the Shadow battleground deck.

name: The Black Fleet
text: +{attack} on Pelargir. If in reserve, you may use your action and eliminate this card to activate Pelargir if it is in the Shadow battleground deck.

name: The Black Serpent
text: If in reserve, you may use your action and eliminate this card to reactivate a Southron battleground.

name: Gothmog
text: When played, remove The Witch-king from the game. While in reserve, draw 1 additional card each Draw step.

flavorText: His broad flat face was swart, his eyes were like coals, and his tongue was red; he weilded a great spear.
name: Black Uruks

flavorText: In the midst there was a huge ram, great as a forest-tree, swinging on mighty chains. Long had it been forging in the dark smithies of Mordor.
name: Grond, Hammer of the Underworld

flavorText: They are strong: battalions of Orcs of the Eye ...
name: Mordor Orcs

flavorText: The lines of fire became flowing torrents, file upon file of Orcs bearing flames.
name: Mordor Orcs

flavorText: The orcs [...] halted and poured their arrows into the defending ranks.
name: Mordor Orcs

flavorText: ... here was yet another company of orcs on the march.
name: Mordor Orcs

flavorText: There seemed to be hundreds of orcs. They brandished spears and scimitars which shone red as blood in the firelight.
name: Mordor Orcs

flavorText: They far surpassed in size and power even the largest of Orc-kind.
name: Olog-Hai

flavorText: Like a storm they broke upon the line of the men of Gondor, and beat upon helm and head, and arm and shield as smiths hewing the hot bending iron.
name: Trolls of Udûn
Gorbag & Shagrat
text: When played or moved to a path, you may cycle 1 card from hand to add +{pathAttack} to this card, or to add +{pathAttack}{pathAttack} if Cirith Ungol is the active path.

name: Grishnákh
text: If on a path, you may use your action and eliminate this card to add 1 corruption.

name: Mouth of Sauron
text: This card cannot be played or moved to a path if a Shadow battleground is active. While in reserve, draw 1 additional card each Draw step.

name: The Beguiler
text: Nazgûl. If in reserve, you may use your action and cycle this card so each Free Peoples played must cycle 1 card from hand.

flavorText: "All black he was himself, too, and cloaked and hooded up, as if he did not want to be known."
name: The Black Easterling
text: Nazgûl. +{defense} on Dol Guldur. When played, draw 1 card.

name: The Commander
text: Nazgûl. If in reserve, you may use your action and cycle this card so each Shadow player draws 1 card.

name: The Destroyer
text: Nazgûl. If in reserve, you may use your action and cycle this card to add {attack} to an active battleground.

name: The Hunter
text: Nazgûl. If in reserve, you may use your action and cycle this card to add {pathAttack} to the active path.

name: The Lidless Eye
text: This card cannot be played or moved to a path if a Shadow battleground is active. When played, each Shadow player draws 1 card. While in reserve, increase your carryover limit by 1.

name: The Messenger
text: Nazgûl. If in reserve, you may use your action and cycle this card to take a Nazgûl character from your cycle pile into hand.

name: The Warrior
text: Nazgûl. If in reserve, you may use your action and cycle this card to add {defense} to an active battleground.

name: The Witch-king
text: Nazgûl. While in reserve, draw 1 additional card each Draw step. If forsaken from the top of your draw deck, cycle this card instead of eliminating it.

name: Black Breath
text: If on a path or battleground, you may use your action and cycle this card, its wielder, and any wielded items, to add 1 corruption.

name: Black Rider's Mount
text: Mount. When played on a wielder in reserve, you may immediately move it to a path (even if it was played this round).

name: Fell Beast
text: Mount. When played on a wielder in reserve, you may immediately move it to a battleground (even if it was played this round).

name: Morgul Blade
text: Weapon. If on a path, you may use your action and eliminate this card to add 1 corruption.

name: Nazgûl's Mantle
text: If the wielder is eliminated in combat, cycle it instead, along with any wielded items.

name: The Black Captain
text: If The Witch-king is in reserve, activate or reactive any Mordor battleground; then, you may move The Witch-king to that battleground (even if The Witch-king was played this round).

name: The Day Without Dawn
text: Draw 7 cards: from these, eliminate 1 card, play up to 2 armies, and cycle the rest.

name: The Ringwraiths Are Abroad
text: Draw 7 cards: from these, eliminate 1 card, play up to 2 Nazgûl characters, and cycle the rest.
